item.title: Report E-2023100195
item.description:
Report E-2023100195

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN3265 Turpinal SL release from a 10-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 5’ x 7’ area of the dock floor due to a puncture. Absorbents and sodium bicarb were deployed and worked into the impacted area to clean and neutralize the release. The damaged pail and cleanup debris were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100247
item.description:
Report E-2023100247

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-12T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 27, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN3265 was punctured by a nail and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. . Crews deployed neutralizing granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged 5-gallon jug of corrosive liquid was placed inside one (1) 30-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023100220
item.description:
Report E-2023100220

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-12T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ERTS was contacted by Tim Pfeffer (Roadrunner Transportation Systems) regarding an approx. 1 gallon release of UN1993 - "D-Limonene Standard" on the Bay dock due to a forklift puncture. The caller has requested a contractor out for cleanup and containment. ERTS dispatched Hepaco Environmental personnel. HEPACO confirmed product released as UN1993 - "D-Limonene Standard. Spill is no longer visible as it has evaporated. The drum was turned upside down by onsite staff as an effort to stop the active leak. Hepaco will place the drum in (1) 65-Gal DM overpack. The overpack drum was staged on site pending disposal confirmation.

item.title: Report E-2023100168
item.description:
Report E-2023100168

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 26, 2023, three (3) 5-gallon pails of UN1993 were damaged during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Response Management Services (RMS) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted are and worked them in using hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal purposes.

item.title: Report X-2023090652
item.description:
Report X-2023090652

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: DECATUR
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived in nondescript brown box with only a fedex label. Blue sand-like material was coming out of the package so package was isolated in a lined tote in QA. Upon inspection saw that the bag was a class 9 hazardous material, Copper Sulfate, but there was no external labeling on the box. Bag is 50 lbs of material while the SDS indicates anything over 10 requiring reporting. DescribePack: A seam at the corner of the box has torn open allowing copper sulfate crystal to pour out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was stored upright in a lined tote, isolated in QA.
